title: 109_hr5812
content: The Act may be cited as the "Appalachian Regional Development Act Amendments of 2006" and includes limitations on available amounts and maximum commission contributions. The "Appalachian Regional Development Act Amendments of 2006" amends Section 14321(a) of title 40, United States Code, regarding grants and assistance. The grant amount shall not exceed 50% of administrative expenses, or 75% at the discretion of the Commission for local development districts in distressed counties. The amendment increases the grant amount for local development districts in distressed counties to 70% of administrative expenses. The amendment allows for financial assistance under this section, with varying percentages based on county designations. In distressed counties, 80% may be provided, in at-risk counties, 70%, and in general, 50% from appropriated amounts. The amendment allows for financial assistance under this section, with varying percentages based on county designations. In distressed counties, 80% may be provided, in at-risk counties, 70%, and in general, 50% from appropriated amounts. Grants for the operation of demonstration health projects may be made for up to 50% of the cost. The amendment allows for financial assistance based on county designations. In distressed counties, 80% of the cost may be provided, in at-risk counties, 70%. The maximum Commission contribution for at-risk counties may be increased to 70%. The amendment to Section 14503 of title 40, United States Code allows for loans for low- and middle-income housing projects. The loan amount can cover up to 50% of planning and financing costs, or 80% in distressed counties. The amendment to Section 14503 of title 40, United States Code allows for loans for low- and middle-income housing projects. The loan amount can cover up to 50% of planning and financing costs, or 80% in distressed counties. Grants for unrecoverable expenses in project planning must not exceed 50% and are restricted from being given to for-profit organizations. The amendment to Section 14504 of title 40, United States Code sets limitations on the amount of expenses that can be covered by grants for telecommunications and technology initiatives. In distressed counties, up to 80% of expenses can be covered, while in at-risk counties, up to 70% can be covered. The amendment sets limitations on grant amounts for entrepreneurship initiatives. In distressed counties, up to 80% of expenses can be covered, and in at-risk counties, up to 70% can be covered. The amendment sets limitations on grant amounts for entrepreneurship initiatives, with up to 80% coverage in distressed counties and up to 70% coverage in at-risk counties. The grant amounts for entrepreneurship initiatives are limited, with up to 80% coverage in distressed counties and up to 70% coverage in at-risk counties. In at-risk counties, project contributions can be increased to 70 percent. SEC. 3. Designation of At-Risk Counties in the Appalachian region most at risk of economic distress. Amends section 14526 of title 40, United States Code to designate these counties as 'at-risk counties'. Conforming amendment made to the analysis for chapter 145 of such title. SEC. 4. Authorization of appropriations for distressed, at-risk, and economically strong counties. SEC. 4. Authorization of appropriations for the Appalachian Regional Commission to carry out projects in fiscal years 2007-2011. Allocation of funds for projects in Appalachian States must come from the State's portion of the Commission's allocated amounts. SEC. 5. Termination. Section 14704 of title 40, United States Code, is amended to change the year from 2006 to 2011. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on October 1, 2006.
